objects.description:
As the user, I want to be able to select how many of minutes my device must be idle before a "Screen timeout" by tapping the "screen timeout" button in Display settings, so that I can use the "Screen timeout picker" to adjust how long it takes for my device to go to sleep.

*Please see issue https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=977880
objects.name: [Settings] Settings - Verify the Screen timeout UI appears correctly.

steps.instruction: Open the Settings app.

steps.expected: A list of options is displayed including Screen Timeout.
steps.instruction: Select "Display" which is found under the Personalization section.

steps.expected:
Then verify that you see :

- 1 minute

- 2 minute

- 5 minutes

- 10 Minutes

- never

- OK
steps.instruction: Select Screen Timeout.

steps.expected: Verify that no flickering occurs on the screen.
steps.instruction: Select any of the options and pay close attention to the screen.

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to cancel any changes I make on the "Screen Timeout Picker" and return to Display Settings, so that I can revert unwanted changes.
objects.name: [Settings] Settings - Display - Screen timeout cancel changes

steps.expected: A list of options is displayed including Screen Timeout.
steps.instruction: Open the Settings app.
Select "Display" under the Personalization section.

steps.expected:
Then verify that you see :

- 1 minute

- 2 minute

- 5 minutes

- 10 Minutes

- never

- OK
steps.instruction: Select Screen Timeout.

steps.expected: The View is returned to the Display menu and the "Screen Timeout" interval is not changed.
steps.instruction: Tap OK.

objects.description:

steps.expected: Anything involving connectivity is automatically reactivated.

objects.description:
As a user, when my device is in "USB Mass Storage Mode", I should recieve a prompt when trying to open the gallery app that tells me that I cannot use the gallery app when this mode is engaged

Prerequisites: Phone is in USB Mass Storage mode.(Plugged into a computer and has USB mass storage turned on.)
objects.name: Verify the user cannot use and a prompt is displayed while in the gallery app when in USB mass storage mode.

steps.expected: You should get a prompt to the effect that:  "You cannot use gallery when USB Mass Storage mode is enabled.  Please turn it off and launch gallery again."
steps.instruction: Open the Gallery app.

objects.description:
As a user, after disengaging from "USB Mass Storage Mode", I expect the Gallery app to rescan my device for new content.  Same goes for recently removed content.

Prerequisites:  Gallery app not open.  USB Mass Storage engaged.  While it is engaged, some pictures were removed.
objects.name: Verify the gallery rescans for recently removed content after disengaging USB Mass Storage.

steps.instruction: Unplug the device.

steps.expected: Gallery app scans and notices any removed content.  The recently removed pictures no longer show up in gallery, and cannot be browsed, perused or edited in any view.
steps.instruction: Open the Gallery app.

objects.description:
As a user, after disengaging from "USB Mass Storage Mode", I expect the Gallery app to rescan my device for new content.

Prerequisites:  Gallery app not open.  USB Mass Storage engaged.  While it is engaged, some pictures were added.
objects.name: Verify the gallery rescans for new added content after disengaging USB Mass Storage mode.

steps.instruction: Unplug the deivce.

steps.expected: Gallery app scans for the new content.  The recently added pictures show up in gallery view and can be browsed, edited and viewed on the device as the other pictures.
steps.instruction: Open the Gallery app.

objects.description: As a user, I want to see a visual representation of my phone's current volume level when I press the up or down key so I can see how loud (or soft) my audio is.

objects.description: As a user, I want to be able to quickly access and browse my open apps from anywhere in the UI, so I can easily manage and/or switch between them.

steps.instruction: Long tap on device Home button

objects.description: As a user, I want my audio level to set to 'vibrate' when I have pressed the 'down' volume key to the end of the visual bar so I have a quick way of going into a 'vibrate' mode with no external audio.
objects.name: [System Overlays] - Activate the 'vibration' mode

steps.expected: The phone's volume level is quickly decreased and after the minimum level is reached the phone goes in the "vibrate" mode.
steps.instruction: Long tap the down volume key situated on the phones side.

objects.description: As a user, I want my audio level to set to 'silent' when I have pressed the 'down' volume key past 'vibrate' mode so I have a quick way of going into 'silent' mode with no vibrate notification or external audio.
objects.name: [System Overlays] - Activate the 'silent' mode

steps.expected: The phone's volume level is quickly decreased and after the  "vibrate" mode is reached the phone goes in the "silent" mode with no vibrate notification or external audio.
steps.instruction: Long tap the down volume key situated on the phones side.

objects.description: As a user, I want visual representation that I am on 'vibrate' mode (if I am on 'vibrate' mode) when I press the up or down volume key so I have a quick indication of what volume / audio mode I am currently using
objects.name: [System Overlays] - Vibration mode notification icon

steps.expected: The phone's volume level is quickly decreased and after the minimum level is reached the phone goes in the "vibrate" mode.
steps.instruction: Long tap the down volume key situated on the phones side.

steps.expected: The icon is highlighted because the phone vibration is on.
steps.instruction: Check the vibration mode notification icon situated in the left side of the volume level bar.

steps.expected: The icon is not highlighted because the phone vibration was deactivated.
steps.instruction: Tap again the Up again the Down volume key.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:

objects.description:

Receive notifications from different apps.
Receive new email notifications.
Receive SMS notifications.
Receive missed call notifications.

steps.instruction: Receive calendar event notifications.

objects.description:
[Email] Test that you can receive, open and download emails with large attachments.

Note: Large attachments can cause sync issues

Prerequisites: Have an email account set up on the device

Please see issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=894834
objects.name: [Email] Test that you can receive, open and download emails with large attachments

steps.expected: The email syncs to the device.
steps.instruction: From a second email account send an email with attachments with a total size close to the account's limit to the test account on the device.( Google and Yahoo max attachment size is around 25 MB )

steps.expected: The email is displayed in Email Message View. Verify that there are no issues while opening the email.
steps.instruction: Tap on the notification to open the email.

steps.expected:
The emails are received and synced on the device; 
Note: attachments are not downloaded on the device until the user specifies.  V1 requirements are only pictures are downloadable.
steps.instruction: From the secondary account send a few more simple emails to the test account.
From the secondary account send an email to the test phone with 3 large files attached. (At least 4MB each or more).

steps.expected: The email is displayed in Email Message View. Verify that there are no issues while opening the email.
steps.instruction: Tap on the notification to open the received email.

steps.expected: The 3 large attachments are download successfully without issue and the email application functions as normal.
steps.instruction: Download all 3 attachments at one time.

objects.description:
Prerequisites: Have an email account set up on the device

Note: Some servers automatically reject these emails but services like Yahoo or Google do not. At most the emails are added in the Spam(Bulk) folders
objects.name: [Email] HTML injection code (meta-content) inserted in html emails body is not executed when replying to  emails

steps.expected: The email is received on the device
steps.instruction:
From Outlook edit an email source or from Thunderbird insert html content( insert menu item in compose view) and add one of the following lines to a new email:


<iframe src="http://www.google.com" width="0.1" height="0.1"></iframe>


or


<meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0;http://cnn.com";> 


Send the email to the account on the device

steps.expected: The HTML injection code is not executed and the Browser app is not opened loading the websites
steps.instruction: Open the email on the device

steps.expected: When the user replies to the email the HTML injection code is not executed
steps.instruction: Select reply and tap in the email body to open the virtual keyboard to start typing a reply

objects.description:
